timeline.message: #1985 - Added an appveyor docker deploy yml file - init test.
#1985 - Try the same with a linux image
#1985 - build and run changes to remove global ensure mvn and config overwrite. Changed to harelmazor dockerhub for further testing.
#1985 - make sure it is running linux and not just switching...
#1985 - Added tag for build, removed web assets, moved deploy to detault build
#1985 - add back java and mvn versions.
#1985 - reduce appveyor changes, fix java version red text.

timeline.bodyText: Is the pom.xml file really necessary here? As we use a jre (second FROM) compiling is not possible anymore.
timeline.author: karussell
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,23 +1,36 @@
-FROM openjdk:8-jdk
+FROM maven:3.6.3-jdk-8 as build
 
 ENV JAVA_OPTS "-server -Xconcurrentio -Xmx1g -Xms1g -XX:+UseG1GC -Ddw.server.application_connectors[0].bind_host=0.0.0.0 -Ddw.server.application_connectors[0].port=8989"
 
-RUN mkdir -p /data && mkdir -p /graphhopper
-
 # install node - only required for JS UI
 RUN apt-get install -y wget \
        && curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_13.x | bash - \
        && apt-get install -y nodejs
 
-COPY . /graphhopper/
-
 WORKDIR /graphhopper
 
+COPY . .
+
 # create main.js - only required for JS UI
-RUN cd web && npm install && npm run bundleProduction && cd ..
+WORKDIR /graphhopper/web
+
+RUN npm install && npm run bundleProduction
+
+WORKDIR /graphhopper
 
 RUN ./graphhopper.sh build
 
+FROM openjdk:11.0.5-jre
+
+ENV JAVA_OPTS "-server -Xconcurrentio -Xmx1g -Xms1g -XX:+UseG1GC -Ddw.server.application_connectors[0].bind_host=0.0.0.0 -Ddw.server.application_connectors[0].port=8989"
+
+RUN mkdir -p /data
+
+WORKDIR /graphhopper
+
+COPY --from=build /graphhopper/web/target/*.jar ./web/target/
+COPY ./graphhopper.sh ./pom.xml ./config-example.yml ./

replies.bodyText:
It is used to get the version in the bash script. Changing the bash script will allow removing this file from the docker file if the version will be fetched from other location or getting the jar file in another method.
My initial attempt where without it, but this is the simplest solution for the docker.
I think the version in the bash file to find the right jar file should use the jar file name instead, but it is fragile and I think out of this scope..
replies.author: HarelM

replies.bodyText: Ah, thanks for finding this out. Can you add a comment and point to this issue on why these files need to be in the Docker image?
replies.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: Somehow there are 0 commits in this PR now. Can you have a look?
replies.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure what happened, some automatic merge of some sort. Should be OK now...
replies.author: HarelM

timeline.bodyText: Can you remove the options -server -Xconcurrentio and -XX:+UseG1GC? We should use the JVM defaults.

replies.bodyText: Sure, I have no clue what all these variables mean so I decided to leave them as they were...

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the tip. I have removed the .5, using 11.0 now.
replies.author: HarelM

replies.bodyText: i think openjdk:11-jre should work too
replies.author: otbutz

replies.bodyText: Minor version changes can still break some code, I prefer to be on the safe side. Feel free to change it though. :-)
replies.author: HarelM

replies.bodyText: I prefer stable and specific versions too. So I would keep it as it is.
replies.author: karussell

timeline.bodyText:
Dropping the package cache might further reduce image size:
RUN apt-get install -y wget \
       && curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_13.x | bash - \
       && apt-get install -y nodejs \
       && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
timeline.author: otbutz
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,23 +1,37 @@
-FROM openjdk:8-jdk
+FROM maven:3.6.3-jdk-8 as build
 
 ENV JAVA_OPTS "-server -Xconcurrentio -Xmx1g -Xms1g -XX:+UseG1GC -Ddw.server.application_connectors[0].bind_host=0.0.0.0 -Ddw.server.application_connectors[0].port=8989"
 
-RUN mkdir -p /data && mkdir -p /graphhopper
-
 # install node - only required for JS UI
 RUN apt-get install -y wget \
        && curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_13.x | bash - \
        && apt-get install -y nodejs

replies.bodyText:
This is not part of the deployed image but it is part of the build image, which is not reflected in the total size.
The current image size is about 130 Mb, there's a way to reduce it if we use jre-slim but then we'll need to add wget to the image, which I'm not sure is so simple.
Also I guess that not all jar files are needed but probably just one which will reduce the image size significantly. But I'm not sure this is entirely related to this issue as the main purpose of this PR is to allow continuous images build.
I can create another PR and open anther issue if there's a need to reduce image size more.
replies.author: HarelM

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I now see the name I gave to this pull request... :-/ In any case, the current changes are good enough on their own I believe. further improvement can be made later on assuming this will be tested to work as expected not just by me :-)
replies.author: HarelM

replies.bodyText:
which I'm not sure is so simple.

See https://stackoverflow.com/a/28885237/194609
replies.author: karussell

replies.bodyText:
My concern is not how simple it is to add wget to the image but rather what else is missing...
Since I don't know I prefer to start of like that and maybe later on reduce the size more when the whole process is up and running.
As I said, there are further improvements that can be made later on.
replies.author: HarelM
